page.title: 08HOME LIFE IN KILLINGHALL
page.content: A survey showed that there were approximately 250 houses in the village and as there are 146 children of school age the village is thriving rather than declining. Although new estates have brought in young people (63 have lived in the village for less than ten years) many people have spent most of their lives in the same house. 81 have live here for over 50 years. Most houses are less than 40 years old and two thirs are houses with most of the remainder bungalows. There are only 16 cottage type dwellings. Although there are enough shops to supply the needs of the village our survey showed only 33 families used them solely, with another 40 doing all their shopping elsewhere, mainly the supermarkets in Harrogate.
